shorts.title: People on the Move, Aug. 3, 2025
shorts.description: Army Heritage Center Foundation Scranton native retired Army Maj. Gen. John L. Gronski has joined the Carlisle-based foundation’s board of directors. Gronski is a veteran of the Iraq War, serving from 1978 to 2019. His decorations include two awards of the Army Distinguished Service Medal, two awards of the Legion of Merit, and the Bronze Star Medal. Gronski will join a local board devoted to telling the stories of soldiers spanning 250 years of Army history, and supporting the mission of the U.S. Army Heritage and Education Center in Carlisle. He attended the University of Scranton and completed a Master […]
shorts.content: Army Heritage Center Foundation Scranton native retired Army Maj. Gen. John L. Gronski has joined the Carlisle-based foundation’s board of directors. shorts.title: John and Karen Voigt
shorts.description: Mr. and Mrs. John Voigt, Clarks Summit, recently celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary on Saturday. They were married Aug. 2, 1975, in St. James Episcopal Church, Aston, by the Rev. Anthony Mattes. They were attended by Ann Voigt Murray, Joann Milcarik Cheesman; Nancy Grasser Russell, matron of honor; Robert Kosinuk, James Sellers and Harry Duey, best man. The couple has three children, Kristen (Matthew) Kostick, Shavertown; Kelly (Matthew) Horn, State College; and Russell Voigt, Wallingford, Pa. They also have four grandchildren, Luke Kostick, Drew Kostick, Grace Kostick and Colin Horn.
shorts.content: Mr. and Mrs. John Voigt, Clarks Summit, recently celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary on Saturday. They were married Aug. 2, 1975, in St. James Episcopal Church, Aston, by the Rev. Anthony Mattes. They were attended by Ann Voigt Murray, Joann Milcarik Cheesman; Nancy Grasser Russell, matron of honor; Robert Kosinuk, James Sellers and Harry Duey, best man. The couple has three children, Kristen (Matthew) Kostick, Shavertown; Kelly (Matthew) Horn, State College; and Russell Voigt, Wallingford, Pa. They also have four grandchildren, Luke Kostick, Drew Kostick, Grace Kostick and Colin Horn.

shorts.title: Sounds, sights, and flavors of the Latino Community fill Nay Aug Park
shorts.title_distilled: Sounds, sights, and flavors of the Latino Community fill Nay Aug Park.
shorts.description: In its 3rd year, the NEPA Latino Fiesta is ensuring every Latino in the community knows they belong.

shorts.title: Raising money for neglected, abused kids at NEPA's Day Downtown
shorts.title_distilled: Raising money for neglected, abused kids at NEPA's Day Downtown.
shorts.description: WILKES-BARRE, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — A local event wrapped up on Saturday to raise money for abused and neglected children. NEPA's Summer In The City celebrated its Second Annual Day Downtown in Wilkes-Barre. The fundraising festival started Saturday morning and continued until 8:00 p.m. It featured something for everyone. Food trucks, small businesses, and carnival [...]
shorts.content: WILKES-BARRE, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — A local event wrapped up on Saturday to raise money for abused and neglected children. NEPA's Summer In The City celebrated its Second Annual Day Downtown in Wilkes-Barre. The fundraising festival started Saturday morning and continued until 8:00 p.m. It featured something for everyone. Food trucks, small businesses, and carnival [...]
